helpText.en:
Select a folder to be used as your workspace. If the folder you select does not exist, it will be created for you.

This folder will contain the rasters produced by this model. If datasets already exist in this folder, they will be overwritten.
helpText.es:
Seleccione una carpeta que será usada como su espacio de trabajo. Si la carpeta no existe, el programa la creará por usted.

Esta carpeta contendrá los raster producidos por este modelo. Si ya existen archivos de previas corridas en esta carpeta, serán sobreescritos.

helpText.en: The project footprint must be a polygon shapefile of the area of development.
helpText.es: El ‘Área de impacto del proyecto’ debe ser un shapefile de polígono del área de desarrollo del proyecto.

helpText.en: Select the impact type of the proposed development.
helpText.es: Seleccione el tipo de impacto del desarrollo propuesto.

label.es: Usar un mapa propio de ecosistemas naturales

helpText.en:
A polygon shapefile of natural ecosystems. The amount and type of biodiversity offset needed is calculated based on the overlap between natural ecosystems and the project footprint, and potential offset patches are also selected from natural ecosystems provided here.

Format: Each row should be a polygon or multi-polygon of a particular ecosystem type. Each column contains information about the ecosystem, and two columns must be named as follows:
  1. ecos_dis: string value with the name of the ecosystem type
  2. factor_de: the numeric compensation factor/mitigation ratio for that ecosystem
helpText.es:
Shapefile de polígono de ecosistemas naturales. La cantidad y tipo de compensación necesaria es calculada por la superposición entre ecosistemas naturales y el área de influencia del proyecto, y los parches potenciales para la compensación también son seleccionados del mapa de ecosistemas naturales provisto aquí.

Format Cada fila debe ser un polígono o un multipolígono de un tipo particular de ecosistema. Deben ser creadas dos columnas denominadas de la siguiente forma
  1. ecos_dis valor en texto con el nombre del tipo de ecosistema
  2. factor_de la tasa numérica de compensación para ese ecosistema.

helpText.en: Select the offset type of your future static map scenarios

A polygon shapefile of potential offset sites for OPAL to select from. If protection is chosen as the offset type to be used, this should be a map of remaining natural ecosystems and can be the same file as the natural ecosystems map input above. If restoration is chosen as the offset type to be used, this should be a map of areas that have the potential to be restored to natural ecosystems.

Format: Each row should be a polygon or multi-polygon of a particular ecosystem type. One column is required, and additional columns will be ignored. The required column must be named as follows:
  • ecosystem: string value with the name of the current ecosystem type if the chosen offset type is protection, or of the ecosystem type to be restored if the chosen offset type is restoration. These ecosystem types must be in the natural ecosystems map in order to match losses and offsets to the same ecosystem type.

A polygon shapefile of the servicesheds for hydrological services, which are the watersheds upstream of drinking water intake points. Impacts for hydrological services will be summed by serviceshed.

Format:
Each row should be a polygon or multi-polygon of the serviceshed for a particular population center. Each column contains information about the serviceshed, and two columns must be named as follows:
  1. Pop_center: string value with the name of the population center or beneficiary group linked to the serviceshed
  2. pop_cent_5: the number of people within the population center or beneficiary group
helpText.es:
Un shapefile de polígono de las 'servicesheds' para servicios hidrológicos. Las ‘servicesheds’ son las áreas aguas arriba que drenan hacia un punto de toma de agua potable. Los impactos para servicios hidrológicos serán sumarizados por 'serviceshed'.

Format
Cada fila debe ser un polígono o multipolígono de la 'serviceshed' para un centro poblado particular. Cada columna contiene información sobre la ‘serviceshed’ y se deben crear dos columnas y nombrarlas como se indica a continuación
  1. Pop_center valor en texto con el nombre del centro poblado
  2. pop_cent_5 el número de personas del centro poblado o el grupo de beneficiarios

label.en: Search Zones (Hard Boundary) and Subzones (Soft Boundary 1)

helpText.en:
A polygon shapefile representing search zones and subzones. Potential offset patches are restricted to the same zone as the project footprint, and the results report indicates which offset patches are located within the same subzone as the project footprint so that they can be prioritized.

Format:
Each row should be a subzone, associated with a priority zone. If subzones are not desired, only a single polygon per zone should be provided. To search the entire study area for offset sites, without restricting by zones, this shapefile should contain a single polygon covering the full extent of the data. The column contains the name of the zone to which each priority search area belongs, and must be formatted as follows:
  1. zone: string value with the name of the zone to which the priority subzone belongs

This is a polygon vector allowing additional level of prioritization of offset parcels, if desired. OPAL tracks which potential offset parcels are located within the same soft boundary polygons as the project footprint so that they can be prioritized for selection in the offset portfolio, if desired. For example, one set of soft boundaries might represent watersheds and the other represent administrative divisions in order to prioritize offsets within the same watershed and administrative unit where possible.

This is a polygon vector allowing additional level of prioritization of offset parcels, if desired. OPAL tracks which potential offset parcels are located within the same soft boundary polygons as the project footprint so that they can be prioritized for selection in the offset portfolio, if desired. For example, one set of soft boundaries might represent watersheds and the other represent administrative divisions in order to prioritize offsets within the same watershed and administrative unit where possible.

A raster file. In Colombia, values should indicate the level of threat from anthropogenic influences at a particular point. Threat is considered an indicator of patch quality for biodiversity. If included, offset patches will be restricted to those with average threat values less than or equal to that of ecosystem patches intersecting the impact site (project footprint). This ensures that offset patches are of equal or greater quality to the impacted patches. Outside of Colombia, any raster indicating quality can be substituted, as long as lower values indicate greater quality
helpText.es: Archivo raster. En Colombia los valores deben indicar el nivel de amenaza antropogénica en un punto particular. La amenaza es considerada un indicador de la calidad del parche en biodiversidad. Si se incluye esta opción, los parches para compensación serán restringidos a aquellos con valores promedio de amenaza menores o iguales a parches que intersectan con el sitio de impacto (área de influencia). Esto asegura que los parches de compensación sean de igual o mayor calidad que los parches impactados. Fuera de Colombia, cualquier raster indicando calidad de hábitat puede ser sustituido siempre y cuando los valores menores indiquen mayor calidad.

helpText.en: A raster file. A raster file whose values indicate the level of species richness at a particular site. Species richness is considered an indicator of patch quality for biodiversity. If included, offset patches will be restricted to those with average species richness values greater than or equal to that of ecosystem patches intersecting the impact site (project footprint). This ensures that offset patches are contain an equal or greater amount of species richness relative to the impacted patches
helpText.es: Archivo raster. En Colombia los valores deberían indicar la riqueza de especies en un sitio particular. La riqueza de especies es considerada como un indicador de la calidad del parche. Si se incluye esta opción, los parches para compensación serán restringidos a aquellos con valores promedio de riqueza mayores o iguales a parches que intersectan con el sitio de impacto (área de influencia). Esto asegura que los parches de compensación son de igual o mayor calidad que los parches impactados. Fuera de Colombia, cualquier raster indicando calidad puede ser sustituido siempre y cuando los valores mayores indiquen mayor calidad.

helpText.en: A polygon shapefile indicating designated areas where development impacts should be avoided. For example, this might include protected areas, RAMSAR wetland sites or other areas where development impacts are discouraged or prevented by law. If the project footprint intersects with an avoidance area, the tool will issue a warning.
helpText.es: Shapefile de polígono indicando áreas designadas en las que deberían ser evitadas actividades de desarrollo. En Colombia, estas también se denominan "Áreas de exclusión". Esto puede incluir áreas protegidas, sitios RAMSAR u otras áreas en dónde las actividades de desarrollo sean prohibidas por la ley. Si el proyecto se superpone con un área a evitar, la herramienta arrojará una alerta. Tales proyectos son improbables de ser permitidos o pueden enfrentar requerimientos adicionales de mitigación más allá que los calculados por la herramienta dadas sus condiciones especiales.

helpText.en: A polygon shapefile indicating priority areas for locating offsets. This map could be based on landscape-level conservation planning exercises, policy or other source of prioritization. If included, the results will indicate which potential offset patches fall within the conservation portfolio so that they can be preferentially selected for the offset portfolio.
helpText.es: Shapefile de polígono indicando las áreas prioritarias para ubicar áreas de compensación. Este mapa puede estar basado en una planificación de conservación de paisaje, políticas u otra fuente de priorización. Si se incluye esta opción, los resultados indicarían que parches potenciales de compensación caerían dentro de qué portafolio de conservación de forma que puedan ser priorizados por el portafolio de compensación.

helpText.en: A polygon shapefile of project footprints of impact sites that have been granted but are not yet represented as developed land in the land use/land cover map. If included, portions of natural vegetation patches that intersect previously granted impacts will be removed from potential offset patches so that they cannot be counted towards offsets.
helpText.es: Shapefile de polígono de áreas de influencia previamente licenciadas pero que no están representadas como áreas de desarrollo en el mapa de usos del suelo. Si se incluye esta opción, parches de vegetación natural que intersectan áreas de influencia previamente licenciadas serán eliminados de los parches potenciales de compensación para que no queden contabilizados dentro de las opciones.

helpText.en: A polygon shapefile of areas that cannot be selected as offsets, either because they have already designated as offsets for other projects, they are not at risk of degradation and so protection would not provide additional benefits beyond baseline conditions (e.g., protected areas), or because their use as offsets is not feasible for political, social, economic or other reasons. If included, vegetation patches within this shapefile will be excluded from potential offset sites in the results.
helpText.es: Shapefile de polígono de áreas que no pueden ser seleccionadas como compensación bien porque ya han sido designadas como compensación por otros proyectos, porque no están en riesgo de degradación de manera que su protección no traería ningún beneficio adicional más allá de las condiciones de línea base (e.g áreas protegidas) o porque su uso para compensación no es viable por razones políticas, económicas o sociales. Si se incluye esta opción, los parches de vegetación dentro de este shapefile serán excluídos de áreas potenciales de compensación.

helpText.en: The mitigation ratio is numeric value indicating the number of units of offsets required to compensate for one unit of ecosystem service loss. The mitigation ratio can be used to account for the additionality of offsets (see the last section of “Generating static maps” of the Users' Guide for more info) and also to adjust for any biases in static maps impact and offset estimates. For example, if simulations from the static map generator indicate that static map estimates of restoration benefits as compared to impacts are lower than InVEST estimates, it may be desirable to specify a mitigation ration greater than 1.

A folder with carbon static maps. These maps can be created using the tool's carbon static map generator.

Contents:
This folder must contain the following rasters:
  • carbon_bare_static_map.tif
  • carbon_paved_static_map.tif
  • carbon__static_map.tif
will be either 'protect' or 'restore', depending on your selected future scenario.
helpText.es:
Carpeta con mapas de carbono almacenado. Estos mapas pueden ser creados usando el generador de mapas de carbono almacenado de la herramienta.

Contents
Esta carpeta debe contener los siguientes raster
  • carbon_bare_static_map.tif
  • carbon_paved_static_map.tif
  • carbon_future_static_map.tif

helpText.en: The mitigation ratio is numeric value indicating the number of units of offsets required to compensate for one unit of ecosystem service loss. The mitigation ratio can be used to account for the additionality of offsets (see the last section of “Generating static maps” of the Users' Guide for more info) and also to adjust for any biases in static maps impact and offset estimates. For example, if simulations from the static map generator indicate that static map estimates of restoration benefits as compared to impacts are lower than InVEST estimates, it may be desirable to specify a mitigation ration greater than 1.

A folder with nitrogen static maps. These maps can be created using the tool's nutrient static map generator.

Contents:
This folder must contain the following rasters:
  • nutrient_bare_static_map.tif
  • nutrient_paved_static_map.tif
  • nutrient__static_map.tif
  • nutrient_bare_pts.tif
  • nutrient_paved_pts.tif
  • nutrient__pts.tif
will be either 'protect' or 'restore', depending on your selected future scenario.
helpText.es:
Carpeta con mapas de nitrógeno. Estos mapas pueden ser creados usando el generador de mapas de nitrógeno de la herramienta.

Contents
Esta carpeta debe contener los siguientes raster
  • nutrient_bare_static_map.tif
  • nutrient_paved_static_map.tif
  • nutrient_future_static_map.tif
  • nutrient_bare_pts.tif
  • nutrient_paved_pts.tif
  • nutrient_future_pts.tif

helpText.en: The mitigation ratio is numeric value indicating the number of units of offsets required to compensate for one unit of ecosystem service loss. The mitigation ratio can be used to account for the additionality of offsets (see the last section of “Generating static maps” of the Users' Guide for more info) and also to adjust for any biases in static maps impact and offset estimates. For example, if simulations from the static map generator indicate that static map estimates of restoration benefits as compared to impacts are lower than InVEST estimates, it may be desirable to specify a mitigation ration greater than 1.

A folder with sediment static maps. These maps can be created using the tool's sediment static map generator.

Contents:
This folder must contain the following rasters:
  • sediment_bare_static_map.tif
  • sediment_paved_static_map.tif
  • sediment__static_map.tif
  • sediment_bare_pts.tif
  • sediment_paved_pts.tif
  • sediment__pts.tif
will be either 'protect' or 'restore', depending on your selected future scenario.
helpText.es:
Carpeta con mapas de sedimentos. Estos mapas pueden ser creados usando el generador de mapas de sedimentos de la herramienta.

Contents
Esta carpeta debe contener los siguientes raster
  • sediment_bare_static_map.tif
  • sediment_paved_static_map.tif
  • sediment_future_static_map.tif
  • sediment_bare_pts.tif
  • sediment_paved_pts.tif
  • sediment_future_pts.tif

label.en: Calculate Impacts/Offsets to Custom Ecosystem Service

helpText.en: The mitigation ratio is numeric value indicating the number of units of offsets required to compensate for one unit of ecosystem service loss. The mitigation ratio can be used to account for the additionality of offsets (see the last section of “Generating static maps” of the Users' Guide for more info) and also to adjust for any biases in static maps impact and offset estimates. For example, if simulations from the static map generator indicate that static map estimates of restoration benefits as compared to impacts are lower than InVEST estimates, it may be desirable to specify a mitigation ration greater than 1.

label.en: Custom Ecosystem Service Static Maps Folder
label.es: Usar mapas propios de otros servicios ecosistémicos

helpText.en:
A folder with custom static maps. These maps can be created using the tool's custom static map generator.

Contents:
This folder must contain the following rasters:
  • custom_bare_static_map.tif
  • custom_paved_static_map.tif
  • custom__static_map.tif


If these custom static rasters account for a hydrological service, the following rasters must also be in this folder:
  • custom_bare_pts.tif
  • custom_paved_pts.tif
  • custom__pts.tif
will be either 'protect' or 'restore', depending on your selected future scenario.
helpText.es:
Carpeta con mapas de servicios ecosistémicos. Estos mapas pueden ser creados usando el generador de mapas de servicios ecosistémicos de la herramienta.

Contents
Esta carpeta debe contener los siguientes raster
  • custom_bare_static_map.tif
  • custom_paved_static_map.tif
  • custom_future_static_map.tif


Si estos raster corresponden a un servicio ecosistémico hidrológico, los siguientes raster también deben estar en esta carpeta
  • custom_bare_pts.tif
  • custom_paved_pts.tif
  • custom_future_pts.tif

helpText.en: Indicates whether the custom ecosystem service input is a hydrological or global service.
helpText.es: Indica si el servicio ecosistémico es hidrológico o global.

helpText.en: Offset scheme options include: ES and biodiversity, ES priority or biodiversity priority. If “ES and biodiversity” is chosen, OPAL will return potential offset parcels that contribute to meeting any ecosystem service or biodiversity target. If “ES priority” is chosen, OPAL will return only potential offset parcels that meet ecosystem service targets, and biodiversity offsets will be chosen from within that set. If “biodiversity priority” is chosen, OPAL will return only potential offset parcels that meet biodiversity targets (i.e., are of the same vegetation type as impacted vegetation), and ecosystem service offsets must be selected from within that set.

Select this checkbox to have the set of offset parcels restricted by the Landscape Context Index.  If this is selected, offset parcels may only be used as offsets to biodiversity if they also have at least the same LCI as the natural parcels that were impacted.

label.en: Proportion of Offset Needs to Suggest

helpText.en: OPAL provides a suggested list of offset parcels likely to meet mitigation needs. This can provide a useful starting place for selecting an offset portfolio. This number determines what proportion of offset needs are included in the suggested list.
